intro: Pepinia filispina, commonly known as the slender-stemmed pepinia, is a flowering plant native to the humid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, often with contrasting white or yellow markings. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial to full shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens and greenhouses.
